H0.text: Elliptical is the type of galaxy most likely described as a large, flat disk surrounded by arms of stars and dust.

H1.text: Irregular galaxies are the type of galaxy most likely can be described as a large, flat disk surrounded by arms of stars and dust.

H2.text: Ring galaxies are the type of galaxy most likely described as a large, flat disk surrounded by arms of stars and dust.

H3.text: Spiral galaxies are large, flat disks surrounded by arms of stars and dust.

A4.text: Most spiral galaxies consist of a flat, rotating disk containing stars, gas and dust, and a central concentration of stars known as the bulge.

A5.text: Spiral galaxies may consist of several distinct components: A rotating disc of stars and interstellar matter of which spiral arms are prominent components
